title: Peabody Energy Strikes Deal to Extend Debt Maturities
sub_head: Coal company struck a deal to push out maturities of nearly $1 billion in debt and credit facilities
body:
Peabody Energy Corp. struck a deal with lenders to push out the coal-mining company’s debt maturities, providing the business with more room to withstand the downturn in coal markets during the coronavirus pandemic.
St. Louis-based Peabody said after the close of these transactions it will have extended maturities on nearly $1 billion in debt and credit facilities and won’t have any funded debt maturing until December 2024. The coal company also said it would be free of a net leverage covenant in its revolving credit facility....
